nodes.text: An IoT based home automation system can provide low cost, wireless, remotely accessible and automated control of multiple home appliances, improving energy efficiency, accessibility, and user convenience
The project develops firmware and a prototype system to automate home appliances with minimal human interaction
The system is controlled via an Android application that communicates with the hardware using socket programming over WiFi
Two user input modes are implemented in the app: Switch Mode (GUI toggles) and Voice Mode (microphone sends intent to Google's servers and parsed string commands)
Hardware components used in the prototype include Arduino UNO R3, Bluetooth Module HC 05, relay module, PCB, wires, power supply and WiFi connectivity
The prototype implements wireless switching of appliances over WiFi with an indoor range of approximately 150 feet
Control and status viewing are available from any WiFi capable device and the app displays the status of each device
The developed firmware automates appliance control to minimize human interaction and preserve device integrity
The prototype design is simple, economical, expandable and claims inherent scalability to add additional devices and functions
App to hardware communication uses sockets over WiFi and employs secure connections (SSL over TCP, SSH) for appliance control
Android OS was chosen for the client app to leverage open source code and built in sensors for system administration
Voice Mode uses the smartphone microphone to send voice data to Google servers which return string data that is parsed and processed to control appliances
Secure socket implementation enables remote switching and status monitoring of appliances over the Internet or intranet
IoT home automation can improve energy efficiency and assist elderly or disabled users by automating controls and enabling remote access
Complexity and cost are barriers to widespread adoption of home automation systems, particularly in emerging markets
Related work demonstrates alternative implementations using NodeMCU with MQTT, IFTTT and Google Assistant, and Raspberry Pi based systems with integrated security sensors and camera modules
